title: Tasks: path property has no effects if pointing out of workspace

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
<!--
Do you have a question? Please ask it on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode.

For bug reports, please fill in the details below. For feature requests, please describe the desired feature.
-->
I want to create an `npm` task where the `package.json` is outside the workspace for whatever reason. I was happy to find the `path` property. As the documentation says: 
> The path to the folder of the package.json file that provides the script. Can be ommitted.

However when I add the path of a folder that contains the `package.json` and is outside of the workspace, the task is ignored and the output of the console is always:
> Error: The npm task detection didn't contribute a task for the following configuration:
```
{
  "type": "npm",
  "script": "foo:start",
  "path": "C:/some/folder/not/in/workspace"
}
```



<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.23.1

title: Contents missing when cut folded text

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
<!--
Do you have a question? Please ask it on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode.

For bug reports, please fill in the details below. For feature requests, please describe the desired feature.
-->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.23.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. type "x[\n][space]y", and fold it.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37881856/40578868-9252496c-610b-11e8-9ef9-d99ece4ae686.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37881856/40578873-a2689dce-610b-11e8-9f0f-e8a4f5848bba.png)
2. CTRL-A and CTRL-X, the "x" and "y" disappeared altogether.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37881856/40578889-dc2c9a06-610b-11e8-94a3-9c64a97a02b3.png)
3. CTRL-V, only the "x" reappeared, and the "y" is lost.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37881856/40578898-0a8e54ca-610c-11e8-9217-0557cd66e96a.png)

However, if I select all the text manually and cut, only "x" will get cut, but "y" will not.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

title: Make vscode.Uri constructor public
body: Issue Type: Feature Request Building a URI from the various parts seems much easier and cleaner to me than using `Uri.parse`, is there any reason why the constructor is not public? VS Code version: Code 1.23.0 (7c7da59c2333a1306c41e6e7b68d7f0caa7b3d45, 2018-05-03T15:23:19.356Z) OS version: Linux x64 4.16.6-1-ARCH

title: Clear problems using a task
body:
Is there any other way to clear problems window, other than using "Reload Window" command?
I would like to perform this from a task. My tasks generate new entries to problems, and I would like to clear the old problems first.

title: Keep getting "Unable to open <file>: File not found" when clicking on Problem links
body:
Issue Type: Bug I'm not currently sure of an exact repro. If this issue is not known, I can try to come up with an exact repro. But this is happening quite a lot with at least my current project, but didn't used to happen before the recent update. What's happening is that I'm getting a lot of problems that don't go away even when fixed, and clicking on it gives the error "Unable to open …: File not found", and asks if I want to create the file. But the file does in fact exist. The only way I know of to get rid of them is restarting vscode. Still repros with all extensions disabled. title: Multiple Additive Drag for Multi Cursor
body:
Feature Request
------------------


Additive Drag for Multiple Selection - Basically Sublime's `Ctrl + Middle Mouse + Drag (Windows)`

This allows you to make additive multi cursor selection. Basically create another multi cursor selection without losing the first.

title: Add ThemeIcons for common test statuses

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
VS Code now has a builtin "test" view that we can contribute to. To render icons against our test nodes we can set the `iconPath` property on the `TreeItem`.  The description of that says:

> Using a theme icon is preferred over a custom icon as it gives theme authors the possibility to change the icons

Since lots of people are going to be adding in test support soon, in order to a) have some consistency and b) allow theming, it would be great if Code shipped some ThemeIcons for passing/failing/errored/skipped tests.

title: I set Dolphin as default file manager, but VSCode opens Nautilus instead of Dolphin
body:
- **VSCode Version:** 1.24.0-insider
- **OS Version:** Ubuntu 18.04 with GNOME, KDE, Unity and XFCE

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I set Dolphin as default file manager via command and in the defaults.list.
2. I open VSCode Insiders
3. I open a folder
4. VSCode opens Nautilus instead of Dolphin

VSCode does not recognise that Dolphin is a new default file manager. 

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled? Yes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Instead of moving the line focus below when enter key is pressed, there should be an option to keep the editor focus line always at the center of the editor.
Suppose the editor displays 20 rows, then the line being edited should always be at the 10th row of the editor.
Every time I am navigating with the cursor to a line above or below, along with moving the cursor, it should move the scrollbar such that the cursor always remains at the 10th row.

title: Inconsistent selection/comment behaviour (minor issue)
body:
With the following code:
```
double
SliderRange::toDataValue( int fromSliderPosition ) const
{
    const double value = minimum_ + ( maximum_ - minimum_ ) / 100.0 * fromSliderPosition;
    const double clamped = std::min( maximum_, std::max( minimum_, value ) );
```
Selecting the first two lines and commenting causes the start of the selection to stay with the 'd' of the first line.

Selecting the last two lines and commenting keeps the start of the selection at the start of the line, which is what I would expect.

This probably has no effect on 99.9% of users, but it causes issues in my extension.

title: Fails to read latest files contents if SSH connection terminates
body:
Linux; CentOS (some version)
I connect to this server over ssh, and use X forwarding to use VS Code on the server.  The VS Code on reload reloads some previous state, from a long time ago; but never updates the current state of files open.  I assume if only saves on graceful exit?  
(Menu popups are not working with the current VS code version 
`code-stable-code_1.23.1-1525968403_amd64.tar.gz`) so I was going to say I can't say which version it is; but I found the download....

Maybe the current state could also be saved when a file is saved?

title: VSCode not scrolling horizontally on hitting Home/End key for lines with more than 10,000 characters
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.23.1
- OS Version: Windows 7, OSX

Steps To Reproduce:

1. Open a new file
3. Add a single line with **exactly 10000** characters (word wrap: off)
4. Hit Home Key, VSCode will scroll to the beginning, following the cursor
5. Hit End Key, VScode will scroll to the end, following the cursor.
6. Add 1 or more characters,
7. Press Home/End keys, cursor moves correctly but VSCode does not scroll along with the cursor.

Expected Result:
VSCode should scroll horizontally in sync with the cursor.

title: Provide a way to dismiss notification messages programmatically
body:
In the Live Share extension for VSCode, we notify the host when someone requests to join the collaboration session:
![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16658549/40318330-150c2738-5cd9-11e8-9a57-1e7c6e5254a8.PNG)
If the joiner cancels their request before the host has responded, we would like to remove the notification on the host's side.  For it to remain visible is misleading, because if the host clicks either button, nothing will happen.  Could you provide a close method that would allow us to remove the notification message?

Corresponding Live Share bug: [https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/live-share/issues/439](url)

title: Simple implementation of drag and drop installation for VSIX extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
- This allows for (one or) multiple VSIX files to be dropped onto the extension viewlet to be installed.
- This will display an error message if there was an issue installing one extension while still successfully installing the other extensions.
Refactor DelayedDragHandler into DragHandler.
- This allows the implementation of DnD handlers that can be disposed.

Targets #12090.

Note that this is not finished, in that it doesn't support Light/Dark themes styling (the dragged-over color is currently hard coded in the CSS).

I'm also unsure as how to proceed regarding the messages to display on success/failure. A few cases (with the current message being displayed):
- One good VSIX file (current: success message)
- Multiple good VSIX files (current: success message)
- One bad VSIX file (missing package.json)  (current: error message)
- One non-VSIX file (current: no message)
- VSIX+non-VSIX files (current: success message)

body:
Please consider supporting [tree-sitter](https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter) grammars in addition to TextMate grammars. TextMate grammars are incredibly difficult to author and maintain and impossible to get right. The over 500 (!) issues reported against https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-TmLanguage are a living proof of this.

This presentation explains the motivation and goals for tree-sitter: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a1rC79DHpmY

tree-sitter already ships with Atom and is also used on github.com.

title: Git diff of too large image file: Unsupported text encoding and NaNTB
body:
<!--
Do you have a question? Please ask it on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode.

For bug reports, please fill in the details below. For feature requests, please describe the desired feature.
-->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.23.1
- OS Version: mac OS 10.13.4 High Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create git repo
2. Create an image file that is larger than the limit for the built-in image preview and commit it to the repo
3. Replace it with a smaller image and look at the diff from the source control view
4. It shows "The file is not displayed in the editor because it is either binary or uses an unsupported text encoding." instead of the preview of the large image. Furthermore it shows NaNTB as file size of the previous image in the status bar.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1394732/40237210-0b0536ba-5ab0-11e8-89d0-42e075705568.png)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

body:
- VSCode Version: 1.23.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.13
- Node version: issue reproduce on 8.x and 10.x

Steps to Reproduce:

1. put a breakpoint anywhere after an await
2. hit F5
3. You'll get to the breakpoint but the debugger hangs. It won't accept new commands (eg. step, continue, etc), and Variables/Block, Local, etc. will show the spinner forever, nothing shows up.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes
